results.title: The Country girl
results.creator_credit: George Seaton, William Perlberg and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly received an Oscar for her brilliant portrayal of the wife, and Bing Crosby gave one of the most outstanding performances of his career as an alcoholic, guilt-ridden has-been. When he is given an opportunity to star in a new musical show, his wife (Grace Kelly) and the show’s director (William Holden) attempt to bolster his ego and help him make a comeback. This superb drama, based on Clifford Odet’s play, was nominated for seven Academy Awards.

results.title: The Cosmic link [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Catherine Fol, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary explores the age-old question of “life” - where do we come from, is there life on other planets, how did life begin? Planet Earth has only one life form: all life on Earth shares some of the same genetic code and has developed from the same evolutionary tree. It is recognised that humans and apes share 98% of the same DNA. But could life have evolved differently out there in the cosmos? Astrophysicists, geologists, biochemists, astronomers, and biopalaeontologists discuss their theories and discoveries, both on Earth and in space, to help shed some light on this mystery of life. Uses microphotography, 3D animation and some excellent cinematography to provide a visual spectacle to what has always been a fascinating subject for discussion. Narrated by Lynne Adams. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Corporation
results.creator_credit: Jennifer Abbott, Mark Achbar, Bart Simpson and Big Picture Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Entertaining, illuminating and exhaustively researched Canadian documentary about the rise in power and stature of corporations, and the impact felt throughout the world. Many topics are examined over the course of this work including exploitation of developing countries, company fraud, environmental impact of business on the natural world, business ethics, corporate espionage, media power, censorship, globalisation, marketing manipulation, privatisation and protests. Featuring a wide array of interviews, witty graphics and a soothing voice-over, the filmmakers succeed in making the complexities of the issues at play here understood whilst enrapturing the audience. Winner of the Best Documentary World Cinema Audience Award at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival. Interviewees include: Naomi Klein, Michael Moore and Noam Chomsky.

results.title: The Cocoanuts
results.creator_credit: Robert Florey, Joseph Santley, Walter Wanger, James R. Cowan, Monta Bell and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Another hilarious film starring Groucho, Harpo, Zeppo and Chico Marx, ‘Cocoanuts’ is one of the early talkie films and the Marx Brother’s first film. Set in Miami, Groucho Marx plays Hotel Manager, Mr Hammer, struggling to keep his establishment from going under. Hammer’s only paying guest is Mrs Potter (Margaret Dumont), whose daughter Polly (Mary Eaton) is in love with aspiring architect, Bob (Oscar Shaw). Mrs Potter would prefer that Polly marry the respectable Harvey Yates (Cyril Ring); little does she know that he is a jewel thief. Throughout this basic story the four Marx brothers create havoc in their usual slapstick manner, with hilarious results.

results.title: The Cornish engine: a chapter in the history of steam power
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Philip Armitage and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Cornish Engine is the name given to the pumping engine built during the 19th century for removing water from the tin and china clay mines of Cornwall. The fame of the Cornish Engine spread through the world but its end was sealed by the invention of more efficient types of engines in the latter part of the 19th century.

results.title: The Cordellera Expedition
results.brief_description: Follows an expedition retracing the steps of Canada’s early explorers including the use of stills and archival footage. Spectacular scenery and wildlife images make this film a must for those who love the outdoors.

results.title: The Club
results.creator_credit: David Williamson, Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll, New South Wales Film Corporation and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Laurie Holden (Jack Thompson) is coach of a Victorian Football League (VFL) team that hasn’t won a premiership for 19 years. Club president Ted Parker (Graham Kennedy) brings in a star recruit at great expense, but youngster Geoff Hayward (John Howard) is a major disappointment. As the club loses a string of games, the coach, president, committee members and players start to tear each other apart. Synopsis source: Australian Screen.

results.title: The Conversation
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Paramount Pictures and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays Harry Caul, an expert surveillance man, who during a routine wire-tapping job hears snatches of conversation which make him believe a young couple is in danger. The more Harry tries to discover the secret surrounding the couple, the more he descends into a nightmare of secrecy, betrayal and murder, all taking place amidst a world of moral ambivalence. Influenced by the Watergate scandals of the early 1970’s, “The Conversation” is a tense and excellently edited suspense thriller. It is also Coppola’s most anguished and personal film.

results.title: The Control revolution
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, National Educational Television and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Explains how the development of the computer has made possible the automatic control of routine tasks in government, industry and business. Presents various computer systems ranging from data processing applications to mechanical control systems. Introduces basic concepts in business information systems including feedback, decision making processes and data modelling.

results.title: The Control of working capital (NP)
results.brief_description: Designed to explain the essentials of business finance to people without any financial background. Uses a dramatic format to explain how a cash crisis can be avoided by reducing working capital in four key areas: purchasing, manufacturing, sales, and credit control. Starring John Cleese and Ronnie Corbett and written by Antony Jay (of “Yes Prime Minister” fame). Suitable for upper secondary level.
